N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-3.5 - Hydrostatic and nondestructive tests

State Regulations

If, in the opinion of the inspector, a hydrostatic test
is necessary, the test shall be applied at a pressure of at least the set
pressure of the lowest safety valve or safety relief valve, but not to exceed
150 percent of the maximum allowable working pressure. In lieu of a hydrostatic
test, if approved by the inspector, radiographic testing, ultrasonic testing, or other applicable nondestructive testing of the repair may be utilized. All
tests shall be applied after the repair has been completed. Notes
